TITLE: José 'Cha Cha' Jiménez, Young Lords founder and civil rights leader, dies at 76
SUMMARY: A public funeral service will take place Thursday evening in Chicago, his family said in a statement on social media after announcing his death

TITLE: FDA proposes putting nutrition info on the front of food packages
SUMMARY: The new labels would put saturated fat, sodium and added sugar directly in front of shoppers to nudge them to make healthier choices

TITLE: Wedding band found under rubble of Altadena home destroyed by the Eaton Fire
SUMMARY: Victoria Desantis left her wedding rings behind as she evacuated, and firefighters were able to find a prized position in the ashes

TITLE: Osteoporosis screening guidelines updated: Do you need a bone scan?
SUMMARY: Many older women are unaware they have the serious bone disease because there are few obvious symptoms

TITLE: Trump and Biden officials begin talks on bird flu crisis
SUMMARY: The H5N1 virus has killed millions of poultry, driving up the price of eggs and causing some shortages.&nbsp

TITLE: Family of a pregnant woman fatally shot by Colorado police reaches $2 million settlement
SUMMARY: Officers in Arvada mistook Destinee Thompson for a shoplifter before she was killed

TITLE: Third former Indiana University basketball player accuses team doctor of sex abuse
SUMMARY: The amended lawsuit against the IU trustees also adds longtime basketball trainer Tim Garl as a defendant, alleging he was aware of the invasive medical exams

TITLE: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' legal team says 'freak off' videos don't show sex trafficking
SUMMARY: The hip-hop stars' attorneys said they were shown videos that prosecutors plan to use as evidence but that the tapes don't depict any illegal activity

SUMMARY: David Lever, a real estate broker, was charged with three counts of murder in the killing of a Marine Corps veteran, a former nurse and a retired professor in North Carolina

TITLE: Obesity wouldn’t be solely defined by BMI under global experts' new plan
SUMMARY: Other measurements, such as waist circumference and evidence of health problems tied to extra weight, would be considered for diagnoses of obesity

TITLE: Deportation fears grow for migrants in Florida under Trump and DeSantis
SUMMARY: Immigrant rights advocates in Florida face a double whammy with the state's and the federal government's promises to increase deportations

SUMMARY: Sherita Harris’ lawyer shared this video, which he said shows the end of the Mississippi Capitol Police car chase that left Harris critically injured

TITLE: Marilyn Manson won't be charged in Los Angeles following sexual assault investigation
SUMMARY: The decision comes after a four-year investigation by prosecutors from the Los Angeles County DA's office and detectives from the Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department

TITLE: What we know about the victims killed in the California wildfires
SUMMARY: Twenty-eight people have died across the Los Angeles area. Officials have said the true death toll isn’t known as the fires continue to burn

TITLE: Despite communication blackout, CDC reports flu is rising nationwide, with spikes in ER visits
SUMMARY: The data on influenza illnesses around the country was made public amid a mandated “pause” in most scientific communications

TITLE: A$AP Rocky gun trial to begin in Los Angeles
SUMMARY: The hip-hop artist is charged with two felony counts of assault with a semiautomatic firearm after allegedly firing on a former friend near a Hollywood hotel in 2021

TITLE: Chicago school district says it was wrong about ICE agents going to a school
SUMMARY: The agents who went to a school were actually U.S. Secret Service investigating a threat over the TikTok ban. It comes amid fears of immigration raids under the new administration

SUMMARY: Secretary of State Marco Rubio, in a memo reviewed by NBC News, said additional guidance would be issued on existing passports containing an “X” sex marker

TITLE: Woman pleads guilty in human smuggling trip in which 16 drowned
SUMMARY: Yaquelin Dominguez-Nieves collected the money from the migrants’ families in the U.S., but the boat bringing them from Cuba to Florida sank. &nbsp

TITLE: Cowboys say offensive coordinator Brian Schottenheimer will be next coach
SUMMARY: Schottenheimer is the ninth coach hired by owner Jerry Jones since he bought the team in 1989

TITLE: Travis Kelce addresses retirement plans if Chiefs win third straight Super Bowl
SUMMARY: Kelce said he hopes to still be playing for the Chiefs when asked what he hopes to be doing in three years

TITLE: What is USAID and how did it become a political firestorm?
SUMMARY: Established by President John F. Kennedy in 1961, the U.S. Agency for International Development provides billions in humanitarian assistance overseas

TITLE: Two prosecutors say they faced retaliation for supporting the Menendez brothers' resentencing
SUMMARY: Nancy Theberge and Brock Lunsford allege they were demoted because of their work supporting resentencing and for their perceived affiliation with former L.A. County DA George Gascón

TITLE: Trump's China tariffs are likely to drive up drug prices and spur shortages
SUMMARY: China is playing an increasing role in manufacturing active pharmaceutical ingredients

TITLE: Bill Gates confirms he has a serious girlfriend, reflects on divorce from Melinda French Gates
SUMMARY: “We’re having fun, going to the Olympics and lots of great things,” he told the "TODAY" show about his girlfriend, Paula Hurd

SUMMARY: The theft occurred around 8:40 p.m. Saturday at Pete and Gerry’s Organics in Greencastle

TITLE: Tiger Woods announces his mother, Kultida Woods, has died
SUMMARY: The golfer shared the news on social media on Feb. 4

SUMMARY: With a $9.2 billion core budget, the CDC is charged with protecting Americans from outbreaks and other public health threats

SUMMARY: A flying beer can struck the executive in the head during the Philadelphia victory parade, but he didn't seem to be bothered by it

TITLE: Fired Yosemite workers say upside-down U.S. flag was a call to protect public lands

SUMMARY: John Pastor-Mendoza falsely claimed to be the driver that the women had requested. He kidnapped and sexually assaulted a dozen women

SUMMARY: Arakawa and her husband, actor Gene Hackman, were found dead last month at their New Mexico home. Her cause of death was determined to be hantavirus pulmonary syndrome

SUMMARY: The imaging tool used to diagnose bone injuries, cancer and other diseases may expose patients to unnecessarily high radiation doses

SUMMARY: From Dockweiler Beach to Long Beach, dozens of disoriented and stranded mammals were found in February and March

SUMMARY: President Donald Trump is expected to sign an executive order to close the Education Department, which he has long pledged to dismantle

SUMMARY: The outcome found Greenpeace liable for hundreds of millions of dollars over actions taken to prevent the construction of the Dakota Access Pipeline nearly a decade ago

SUMMARY: The Alaska Volcano Observatory said now is a good time for Alaskans to "familiarize themselves with the possible hazards of a Spurr eruption

SUMMARY: Geilond Vido-Romero, 24, and Joel Jose Gonzalez-Gonzalez, 32, "are still at large and the search is ongoing," ICE said

TITLE: Celtics to be sold to private equity co-founder for $6 billion, reports say
SUMMARY: William Chisholm, a Massachusetts native and lifelong fan, will purchase the historic NBA franchise

SUMMARY: Terence Haggerty, owner of Jody’s Club Forest, says his dad came up with the idea to bet on the NCAA basketball tournament in the mid-1970s. The original jackpot of $880 grew to $1.6 million

SUMMARY: The 15-year-old girl was shot dead by deputies following a vehicle chase led by her father, who had killed her mother and driven off with the girl

SUMMARY: Florida's Elite Eight win puts it in the Final Four for the first time since 2014. The Gators beat the Red Raiders 84-79

SUMMARY: The boy, who wasn’t identified, had “multiple visible injuries” and indications that his ankles had also been bound, police said

TITLE: It's time to worry about bird flu in cats
SUMMARY: Three pet owners whose cats got bird flu describe their symptoms and quick declines. As such cases mount, public health experts are warning about raw meat and raw milk

SUMMARY: Millions of Americans are born predisposed to high levels of a cholesterol called lipoprotein(a). Doctors are finally figuring out how to treat it

TITLE: Idaho man arrested and accused of striking Tesla counterprotester with car, police say
SUMMARY: Christopher Talbot, 70, was charged with aggravated battery, Meridian police said

SUMMARY: Over the last year, thieves have targeted freight trains traveling through the Mojave Desert in the southwestern U.S., specifically targeting Nike sneakers

SUMMARY: A Democratic senator says the party's brand is "problematic." And the NCAA men's and women's basketball tournaments are getting down to business

TITLE: Michelle Obama addresses her future and making her own decisions amid divorce rumors
SUMMARY: The former first lady emphasized wanting to think deliberately about how she was spending her time. Women, Obama said, “struggle with disappointing people

TITLE: Missouri foster mom to 200 is accused of trading a child for an exotic monkey
SUMMARY: Brenda Ruth Deutsch, 70, was arrested on abuse allegations

TITLE: The USDA cut $500 million in funding to food banks. Here’s how they’re coping.
SUMMARY: “These reductions don’t just affect people facing hunger — they also hurt the retailers, farmers, and businesses that supply fresh, local food to our region,” says Beth Martino, CEO of Three Square Food Bank in Southern Nevada

SUMMARY: The youngster "remained calm" and gave police "vital information" that helped them capture the suspect

SUMMARY: U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi announced in a Fox News interview that the administration had "pulled all nonessential funding from the Department of Corrections in Maine

SUMMARY: More than 600 cases have been confirmed so far this year. NBC News is updating case totals twice every week

SUMMARY: Military pilot Jo Ellis said she had to hire private armed security for her family because of the false claims, which went viral on social media

SUMMARY: Officials say Ahkeema Love attacked a woman who may have been her romantic rival

SUMMARY: Sonya McKnight, a judge in Dauphin County, was accused of shooting her boyfriend in the head and trying to convince him he had shot himself

TITLE: Postage stamps may be getting more expensive — again
SUMMARY: The U.S. Postal Service is looking for a rate increase this summer that would raise the cost of a first-class stamp from 73 cents to 78 cents
